column4: [Bug 46612] Re: Printer Queue Never Empties    what to do about this???
system administration printing and remove it all from there  lpq and check out what jobs are sitting there and then lprm job_number
HOW from there? i just got printers there no jobs or queue?
no entries says lpq?!??!  but when i print it just says more and more in queue
did you do the System Administration Printers from the menu yet?
i found some jobs now with lpq -a      Yes i did and say EXACTLY what do there cuz i cant see any useful in there. its just printers there. no jobs
active  root    16      Test Page                       153600 bytes   how type with "lprm" now?
why are you printing as root  -0 that is nuts
i dont know. just clicked "print test page"
this is usually an indication that the printer driver is wrong
ok but i can print with usb... though i cant get lpr working :(
there are no correct driver for my canon mp800 but ip4200 should do the trick according to google so thats what im running
setup from that system - admin - printing       -- that may help - and search for a ppd file do download for that
no ppd file. No drivers for canon mp800. canon ip4200 inside ubuntu and should work.
